author: .bfs
content: let's say im running a devnet and want to test a validator deposit/activation. how do I do this without using the ethereum launchpad site?

author: .bfs
content: as far as i can tell, the staking deposit cli only generates the keys/deposit manifest

author: sky.cactus
content: There used to be a testnet version of the site, not sure if it is still around.  Try throwing a goerli or sepolia subdomain on the launchpad site maybe?  Or see if there is a network chooser somewhere on it?

author: .bfs
content: can't use the testnet version since it's a devnet and only running locally

author: .bfs
content: im pretty sure the launchpad site is just submitting an exec layer transaction and that's it, but I don't wanna go into the weeds to set up a transaction if there's another tool that can do it easily

author: .bfs
content: yeah so all the data needed to call deposit() on-chain is in the deposit_data.json file that gets emitted by the tool. launchpad just takes those values and turns them into a tx

author: kevinbogner
content: for devnet I've used https://github.com/protolambda/eth2-val-tools to generate `deposit_data` and https://github.com/wealdtech/ethereal to execute them

author: kevinbogner
content: Pari also wrote a guide here https://parithosh.com/2021/06/09/2021-09-06-eth2-deposits/
